name: Raas Haveli

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved arriving at the Raas haveli and discovering the beautifully designed setting with impressive views of the fort up above.
reviews.title: Oasis in Jodhpur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A peaceful enclosure (when the mosque is not sending out its prayer) and a nice retreat after having spent a couple of days in Jaisalmer and the dessert. We weren't particularly impressed with the breakfast (not a huge amount of choice) but the food at dinner and lunch was good. Happy to be centrally located so we could visit the surrounding streets and a short climb to the fort. I would advise to visit the fort without a personal guide and take the audio guides available on request and then take a guide to visit the streets of old town Jodhpur. We enjoyed our tour of the old city with our guide Ram however we did feel pressured into buying things (from the textile warehouse, from the perfume shop, from the spices shop). A common feeling I think for most tourists in India! We wished we had been more insistent on what we wanted to do at the beginning of our walk. Unfortunately our stay at the Raas came at the end of our trip to India so we were well used to this tactic and were therefore not enthusiastic on shopping. We also had to pay 100rps for a short rickshaw ride which seemed overpriced.
reviews.title: A perfect home base for a Jodhpur visit
Terrific hotel
reviews.text: Nevertheless I would still recommend a guide to go around the streets as you will see another side of life in the city. If you have a good map you could probably do this yourself but with a guide we felt a little less vulnerable.

The staff at reception were extremely welcoming and we particularly liked the way they sent us off with a blesing for a safe trip home. I would definitely recommend this hotel - 2 nights is a minimum so you can sightsee one day (fort and old city) and relax on another.
reviews.title: Wow, fantastic hotel

reviews.text: Part of the delight was the route to this wonderful hotel, through the busy market, down very narrow lanes. Then, this stunning oasis of modern design, comfort, and exceptional service. And the surprise: no charge for wifi (what a contrast to some of our other hotels in India). Our room on the second floor was perfect, with the view of the garden and the fort above. I actually loved hearing the calls to prayer (but not so much the music playing in the garden at that early hour). I began my stay with a fine massage, with an unexpected touch I'll remember forever: when I lay face down, I was looking at a bowl of rose petals! The food was so delicious we had dinners at the hotel both nights, and my husband is still talking about his favorite-pizza-ever. We ate on the terrace for the views, and appreciated the nice hot coals that made it possible. We were very grateful for our wonderful servers and their guidance to dishes that would not be too spicy for us. Breakfast choices were beautifully presented and delicious, too. I'd love to go back for a longer stay in warmer weather.
reviews.title: Beware

reviews.text: We visited Raas in October and found it a delightful retreat in the heart of old town. We stayed in the main building-our large balcony providing amazing views of the fort on the hill. The hotel has two restaurants and a spa in fabulous architecture. The staff is very helpful and friendly, especially to our two young children. The food was good and child friendly-but pretty mild. The rooms and bathrooms are spacious and well designed. The massages were relaxing and affordable.
reviews.title: A lovely escape

reviews.text: We were supposed to go desert camping, but after a three hour drive to the middle of nowhere, found that the tented camp hadn't been finished. We contacted Raas and asked if there were any rooms available for us to return to. They were incredibly helpful, and got us 'our' room again. We would go back in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Great view and location
A "4" in India, a "3.5" elsewhere

reviews.title: its all about the view!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Raas for three nights and had a lovely suite on two floors, both with a balcony. From each of those and from the hotel generally, there are fantastic views up to the Meherangarh fort standing on its hilltop commanding the town. Modern architecture of very high quality and superb execution in crafted red sandstone, has been used to enfold and augment the heritage buildings comprising much of the complex, which also contains the most delightful gardens. Food at every meal and in each of the restaurants was first rate.
reviews.title: Location, location and ....er, location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An outstanding feature was the service - the best we experienced anywhere in India. Staff were smart, attentive, politely outgoing and knew their business. They magically appeared whenever needed and discreetly withdrew thereafter.
reviews.title: Fantastic place with lovely design

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As to the "....er, location!" : the area imediately outside the hotel gates is pretty unattractive and, more significantly, the P.A. system at the mosque WAS disturbing. The prayers were much longer than 'advertised' and between whiles there appeared to be programmes of poular entertainment! It by no means ruined our stay - which we enjoyed enormously - but it takes away one point from what would otherwise be a 5+ rating.
reviews.title: Raas: Jai Mata Ji Ki full on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wow! I don't often wow but this place gets a wow! From the glass cube of the reception area to the stunning view of the fort from our room, from the pool to the restaurant and bar and not forgetting the fact you could see the fort from our living area which was above the bedroom that also had a view of the fort and would you believe you had the same view when in the tub or in the shower!
reviews.title: fabulous hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When you walk through the building into the pool area you cannot fail to appreciate the great thought and design that has gone into this hotel. It is truly superb.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: A treasure in the heart of the city with the view of the treasured Fort. Is walking distance to, shopping, beautiful step wells and other secrets to the city. India's one of a kind 5 Star Boutique hotel in a romantic setting.. A place you don't want to leave.
reviews.title: Phenomenal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Raas hotel is beautiful with amazing staff. It is an architectural gem with exquisite gardens and i would certainly recommend it for a stay in Jodhpur.The fort view rooms would be the best as in the garden rooms you cannot quite appreciate the simply stunning view of Jodhpur's fort. Excellent restaurant. For me the outstanding attentiveness of all the staff, including the general manager, made the stay there very comfortable.
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: This is our fourth or fifth time back at Raas, and we keep coming back for more. The good news is that the service levels are just as good as they always have been, and the bad news is that there really is no bad news.
reviews.title: We keep coming back for more
An experience you cannot miss
reviews.text: This time we were there as a group of 16 people, to celebrate my wife's birthday. We got a heritage suite above the spa. Unlike most of the rooms, this is not in a newly-built building, but the quality of finish, fittings and layout is just as good, with the added attraction of the original stone arches (inside) and sitting areas (outside the room).

The food and service were excellent. One night, we started with cocktails on the roof top, followed by a sit-down dinner in the garden. The next evening we went out of the hotel, but the the staff were incredibly friendly, and my wife was given a birthday cake by the Chef.
reviews.title: Great location, close to Fort and markets, like an oasis

description: Inside the Walled City of Jodhpur and under the imposing stare of Mehrangarh Fort, sits RAAS. The site was formerly the home of the aristocratic Thakur family, and the original 18th-century haveli has been carefully renovated to produce the four old buildings of the hotel. The three new buildings are modern and contemporary in their use of space and light, and yet are grounded in tradition. Jodhpur's red sandstone unites the new with the old, with modern designs in its latticing and carving adding a fresh dimension to the region's age-old stone carving industry. This seamless harmony between the old and the new, the modern and the traditional, extends to all aspects of RAAS. Almost all of the rooms have magnificent views of Mehrangarh Fort from both the private terraces and from the cast iron bathtubs, and those that don’t have their own private gardens and views over the old haveli and landscaped gardens of RAAS. The rooms are furnished with state of the art amenities: all rooms are air-conditioned with the latest eco friendly machines, and have overhead fans, hairdryers, safes, central heating, wi-fi, TV, telephones and en suite bathrooms. There are rooms with easy access for the handicapped and non-smoking rooms. RAAS boasts two fine dining restaurants, which offer both Indian and International cuisine: Darikhana is a beautiful terraced restaurant and the Baradari Café is inside the old pavilion and offers a relaxing location near the pool. There is also a luxury spa that offers a full range of treatments and a boutique shop. RAAS is the ideal place to soak up the rich local heritage of Jodhpur while at the same time indulging in opulent luxury and comfort. As soon as you drive through the old wooden gates in RAAS’s very own blue tuk-tuk, the majesty of Mehrangarh Fort will be tempered by your sense of relaxation.
